block.p: Tamara Beth Shear and Matthew Carl Leopold were married last evening at the Watergate Hotel in Washington. Rabbi David Saperstein officiated.

Mrs. Leopold, 32, is the vice president in New York of Natalie P. Shear Associates, an event and conference management firm in Washington, of which her mother, Natalie Lewis, is the president. The bride graduated from New York University.
Tamara Beth Shear and Matthew Carl Leopold were married last evening at the Watergate Hotel in Washington. Rabbi David Saperstein officiated.
Tamara Beth Shear and Matthew Carl Leopold were married last evening at the Watergate Hotel in Washington. Rabbi David Saperstein officiated.

Mrs. Leopold, 32, is the vice president in New York of Natalie P. Shear Associates, an event and conference management firm in Washington, of which her mother, Natalie Lewis, is the president. The bride graduated from New York University.

Her mother and stepfather, Henry Lewis, live in Chevy Chase, Md. The bride's late father, Daniel Shear, retired as the general counsel of the National Capital Planning Commission, which provides planning guidance for federal land and buildings in the National Capital Region.
Mr. Leopold, 34, is a financial adviser in New York for Northwestern Mutual, a financial services company based in Milwaukee. He graduated from the University of Hartford.

He is a son of Gail Stolz of Westport, Conn., and Sidney Leopold of Boca Raton, Fla. The bridegroom's mother is a consultant who recruits foreign students to be summer camp counselors. His father retired as the controller of Viking Aluminum Products, a manufacturer of aluminum windows, roofing and siding in New Britain, Conn. The bridegroom is a stepson of Arlene Leopold and of Alan Stolz.
